reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bedroom was a little small but had everything we needed. The hotel is situated in a great place and Nykoping itself is worth exploring. We caught the train to Stockholm takes about an hour and again we were impressed with the standard and efficiency of the public transport. as had caught the local bus to the hotel from Skavsta airport. The people we met were lovely and very helpful. Would definately go again and stay at this hotel, one word of warning if you are staying over on a Sunday night the hotel restaurant and most of the others in Nykoping do not open we ended up with a take away pizza a good one at that, but not quite what we had planned.
reviews.title: Excellent all round

reviews.text: An excellent, modern hotel with lovely decor, helpful staff and a very convenient location just off the main shopping street. The food too was very good indeed with buffets available for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Nykoping itself is a very pleasant little town with a bustling harbour area with good restaurants. Would definitely stay there again .

reviews.title: So friendly!
reviews.text: Nykoping is about 3 miles from the small main airport that Ryanair fly into. Once at the airport it's so easy to get a bus direct to either Nykoping which is ten minutes away or Stockholm 2 hours. I found the Park Inn hotel excellent value. Don't be put off by the outside, the inside is welcoming and the staff friendly. Good breakfast plenty of choice, hot and cold. All day coffee and tea lunchtime buffet or meals and a small cafe attached with cakes and hot beverages. The rooms are clean and warm, with coffee and tea making facilities. Sauna free to guests after 5pm. The bus station is 5 minutes away and the train station 10 minutes, but you cant hear the trains as they are so quiet. We went to stockholm for the day, and it was brilliant! it's not expensive to travel around. Even cigarettes are cheaper than uk. Nykoping has its own unique shopping centre, and a pub called the twist with an English theme. The food there was fantastic and very reasonable. We also found loads of walks around the river which runs into a harbour near the baltic sea. This time of the year it was frozen but what a sight! Don't be put off because it's a small town, it has a lot to offer. He even has its own nightclub. The Park Inn hotel was one of the best I've stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We atayed at the Park Inn Hotel in Nykoping for two nights in January 2008. I thought I should take a few minutes of my time to give a short review. The hotel was one of the best that we have stayed in for a while. I have nothing but praise for the staff, that went out of their way to be polite, courteous and very helpful. The rooms were nice and the hotel was very clean. Breakfasts were truly wonderful with a tremendous selection on offer. A truly pleasant, happy and memorable stay and we would have no hesitation whatsoever in returning here again in the future.
